entry.et: Middle English, from Old English cyssan; akin to Old High German kussen to kiss

def.dt: :to touch with the lips especially as a mark of affection or greeting kissed his wife good-bye
:to touch gently or lightly wind gently kissing the trees
:to salute or caress one another with the lips
:to come in gentle contact
:to act obsequiously especially to gain favor
:leave
:to resign oneself to the loss of
:to act obsequiously toward one especially to gain favor
:to curry favor with
:a caress with the lips a range of kisses from a passionate embrace to a friendly peck
:a gentle touch or contact
:a small drop cookie made of meringue
:a bite-size piece of candy often wrapped in paper or foil
:an expression of affection sent him kisses in her letter
:telling details of private matters kiss–and–tell autobiographies

entry.et: from the kiss with which Judas betrayed Jesus (Mark 14:44–46)

def.dt: :something (as an act or association) ultimately causing ruin
:to dismiss usually lightly kisses the other performers off as mere amateurs
:artificial respiration by the mouth-to-mouth method
:a ceremonial kiss, embrace, or handclasp used in Christian liturgies and especially the Eucharist as a sign of fraternal unity
:to greet from a distance with a kissing motion of the lips
:an open-mouth kiss usually involving tongue-to-tongue contact
:french kiss
